Imagine that you can make a difference

Imagine that you can have your private mentor that will guide you through the complex path to become a great programmer.

Imagine that you can be the one, that will help someone in getting skills that can change his life. Imagine that you can have a real impact on the world. Imagine that you can create opportunities. And you already have everything that it takes to do it - your knowledge, your experience, your skills. And it takes only few moments of your time. And you will be doing only things that you do everyday at your work.

Become a mentor

You love programming and think that everyone should be able to code? we will give you a way to teach.

You can choose how much time and effort you want to put into that. You can do a code review or help with small bugs just from time to time, just when you have a free moment - just pick a help request from our backlog and answer it.

Or you can choose a specific person and guide them step by step, show them what to learn and how, share your best sources of knowledge, share you experience, give you expertise. Education changes peopleâ€™s life. You can change them too.

How it works for mentors

  • log in with your github account

  • tell as how you want to participate

    • become a mentor for one or more choosen students
    • do a code review on github whenever you have time
    • answer questions/help with bug fixing
  • do a lot of good stuff!
  • surprise! you can also become a student and learn some now technologies
Sign up

Get a mentor

You just started learning to code, done few first steps and have no idea what to do next? All informations you find in the internet are overwhelming and give you the feeling of being totally lost? You wish someone just told you what to do next? Find yourself a mentor, who will help you choose the right path.

Or maybe you already wrote some lines of code and wish someone could check the quality of it - just ask one of the experts for code review. They will tell you what you can improve.

How it works for students

  • log in with your github account

  • apply for a mentorship

    • you need to sell yourself a bit here, write a note about yourself to convince mentor to choose you above other applicants, include why you want to learn and what you want ot accomplish
    • browse through our base of experts and the one (or more) you want to learn from

  • create a request

    • if you need someone to do a code review for your code - past a link to your pull request
    • it you have a particular problem past your code on codepen.io and add link to the request (important: you need to add code)
    • remember to assign it to the technology it's written in - so we can send it to the experts in that field
    • get the help you needed
  • when you feel comportable with your new skills become a mentor too - so you can spread the coding knowledge to others
